on a laptop?
right click on the speaker in the notification area (next to clock) and select 'Open Volume Control;
make sure PCM, Master, and Headphone are all unmuted and turned up.
did you turn up the volume on them?
any sound out speakers?
you won't be able to hear sound through the speakers if your headphones are plugged in.
click on file > Change Device in the Volume Control window and make sure that the ALSA adapter is selected
i'm not sure at this point. There's no sound from the onboard speakers at all? No gnome sounds or anything?
I'm afraid there's a lot of problems with laptop mics under alsa right now.
open up a console and run alsamixer
possibly. I can't remember what the problem was, but it's a known bug
but make sure none of the channels in alsamixer are muted
still get sound out of headphones?
